channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration rolls back $2 billion mental health, addiction grant cuts
item.description: Sweeping cuts to mental health and addiction programs worth more than $2 billion are being reversed. After a political backlash from Republicans and Democrats, the grant money will be restored.
item.content:encoded:
Sweeping cuts to mental health and addiction programs worth more than $2 billion are being reversed. After a political backlash from Republicans and Democrats, the grant money will be restored.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: U.S. to suspend immigrant visas from 75 countries over public assistance concerns
item.description: The State Department says it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries whose nationals are deemed likely to require public assistance while living in the United States.
item.content:encoded:
The State Department says it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries whose nationals are deemed likely to require public assistance while living in the United States.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the USPS made sure new Muhammad Ali stamps pack a punch
item.description: Artist Antonio Alcala gets the stamp of approval for his new USPS postage stamp.
item.content:encoded: Artist Antonio Alcala gets the stamp of approval for his new USPS postage stamp.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: Candidates have legal standing to challenge election laws, the Supreme Court rules
item.description: In a case related to Illinois state law about the return of mail ballots, the U.S. Supreme Court says political candidates have the legal standing to challenge election policies.
item.content:encoded:
In a case related to Illinois state law about the return of mail ballots, the U.S. Supreme Court says political candidates have the legal standing to challenge election policies.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Trump administration sends letter wiping out addiction, mental health grants
item.description: The Trump administration sent hundreds of letters Tuesday terminating federal grants supporting mental health and drug addiction services. The cuts could total as much as $2 billion.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration sent hundreds of letters Tuesday terminating federal grants supporting mental health and drug addiction services. The cuts could total as much as $2 billion.

(Image credit: Erik McGregor)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: New analysis on U.S. economy. And, MN prosecutors quit over DOJ probe into Good widow
item.description: Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Renee Macklin Good's widow.
item.content:encoded:
Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Renee Macklin Good's widow.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The risks of AI in schools outweigh the benefits, report says
item.description: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.content:encoded: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Several federal prosecutors in Minnesota resign over ICE shooting investigation
item.description: Top federal prosecutors in Minnesota resigned after the Department of Justice pressured them to investigate the widow of a woman killed by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: Top federal prosecutors in Minnesota resigned after the Department of Justice pressured them to investigate the widow of a woman killed by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Former federal prosecutor talks about Minnesota ICE shooting probe and Trump's DOJ
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former federal prosecutor and Politico writer Ankush Khardori about the resignation of several federal prosecutors in Minnesota over the ICE shooting probe.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former federal prosecutor and Politico writer Ankush Khardori about the resignation of several federal prosecutors in Minnesota over the ICE shooting probe.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: NASA set to bring astronaut (and the rest of Crew-11) home early for medical reasons
item.description: In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.
item.content:encoded:
In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce
